label.name: Date
label.description: A point or period of time associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource.

label.name: Date
label.description: A point or period of time associated with an event in the life cycle of the resource.

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Digital Image Dimensions
label.description: Pixel width and height.

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Digital Image Dimensions
label.description: Pixel width and height.

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Identifier
label.description: Identifier external to CollectiveAccess, which points to a preservation AIP package identifier, from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if multiple identifiers exist, or if multiple AIP identifers comprise the object or object representation described (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives, multiple AIPs may be created).

label.name: Analog Audio Tracks
label.description: List the number of audio tracks pertaining to the item in question.

label.name: Film Length
label.description: Include units of measure.

label.name: Film Time Start
label.description: Include units of measure.

label.name: Running Speed
label.description: In frames per second (fps).

label.name: Copyright Status
label.description: Associated with entity.

label.name: Additional Title
label.description: title is a name or label relevant to the asset. There may be many types of titles an asset may have, such as a series title, episode title, segment title, or project title, therefore the element is repeatable.

label.name: Historical Description
label.description: Descriptions derived from other historical sources such as Whispered Art History and Front Magazine

label.name: Content Description
label.description: Narrative description of the intellectual work / event

label.name: Coverage
label.description: coverage refers to either the geographic location or the time period covered by the asset’s intellectual content. For geographic locations (‘spatial’ descriptors), it is expressed by keywords such as place names (e.g. ‘Alaska’ or ‘Washington, DC’), numeric coordinates or geo-spatial data. For time-based events (‘temporal’ descriptors), it is expressed by using a date, period, era, or time-based event that is portrayed or covered in the intellectual content (e.g. ‘2007’ or ‘Victorian Era’). The PBCore metadata element coverage houses the actual spatial or temporal keywords. The companion element coverageType is used to identify the type of keywords that are being used.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a dropdown with search results (ordered by score). Selected geoname is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Related Event
label.description: Related event refers to any occurrence that contains multiple works

label.name: Event
label.description: Event refers to any works that fall under the same multi-day Event

label.name: Description
label.description: pbcoreDescription is an element that uses free-form text or a narrative to report general notes, abstracts, or summaries about the intellectual content of an asset. The information may be in the form of an individual program description, anecdotal interpretations, or brief content reviews. The description may also consist of outlines, lists, bullet points, rundowns, edit decision lists, indexes, or tables of content.

label.name: Asset Type
label.description: pbcoreAssetType is a broad definition of the type of intellectual content being described. Asset types might include those without associated instantiations (a collection or series), or those with instantiations (programs, episodes, clips, etc.)

label.name: Rights Link
label.description: rightsLink is a URI pointing to a declaration of rights.

label.name: Rights Summary
label.description: rightsSummary is used as a general free-text element to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over an asset or instantiation, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified as needed

label.name: Annotation
label.description: pbcoreAnnotation allows the addition of any supplementary information about the metadata used to describe the PBCore record. pbcoreAnnotation clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Library Of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Genre
label.description: pbcoreGenre is an element that describes the Genre of the asset, which can be defined as a categorical description informed by the topical nature or a particular style or form of the content.

label.name: Caption
label.description: Short descriptive caption for item.

label.name: Source Of Title
label.description: The source for the title, generally a published source.

label.name: Description
label.description: Use to provide a brief synopsis of the document, image, or object. May include an abstract, table of contents, description of style, materials, and /or techniques used, brief delineation of the historical context of the object, and /or a few points concerning the significance of the resource. Use for short transcriptions. Example: Depicts unknown automobile driver stopping at roadside to add water to engine on all-day drive from Chico to Sacramento. Exact location unknown. Verso stamped with 596; manuscript note indicates car owned by “N.E.R.” (NCSU)

label.name: Languages
label.description: A language of the resource.

label.name: Country
label.description: Complete name of country

label.name: Institution
label.description: Name of the institution to which the collection belongs.

label.name: Biography
label.description: Narrative biography for entity and source.

label.name: Source Of Description
label.description: Source of entity biography. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Organizational Description
label.description: Narrative description for organizational entity and source.

label.name: Source Of Description
label.description: Source of entity description. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Nationality
label.description: National or cultural affiliation of the person or corporate body.

label.name: Vital Dates
label.description: A description of the lifespan of the person or the existence of an organization, using ca. and any other expressions of uncertainty or nuance. For Birth and Death date attributes, record years of birth and death, estimated where necessary. For a corporate body, use birthdate and deathdate to record the dates of founding and dissolution.

label.name: Gender
label.description: The gender of an individual.

label.name: File
label.description: If uploading in the Media bundle above rejects the file above, then upload here using a separate tool for file identification.

label.name: Instantiation Rights Link
label.description: rightsLink is a URI pointing to a declaration of rights.

label.name: Instantiation Rights Summary
label.description: rightsSummary is used as a general free-text element to identify information about copyrights and property rights held in and over an asset or instantiation, whether they are open access or restricted in some way. If dates, times and availability periods are associated with a right, include them. End user permissions, constraints and obligations may also be identified as needed

label.name: Instantiation Time Start
label.description: instantiationTimeStart describes the point at which playback begins for a time-based instantiation. It is likely that the content on a tape may begin an arbitrary amount of time after the beginning of the instantiation.

label.name: Instantiation Data Rate
label.description: The amount of data in a digital media file that is encoded, delivered or distributed, for every second of time.

label.name: Instantiation Colours
label.description: Indicates the overall colour, grayscale, or black and white nature of the presentation of an instantiation, as a single occurrence or combination of occurrences in or throughout the instantiation.

label.name: Instantiation Tracks
label.description: The element instantiationTracks is simply intended to indicate the number and type of tracks that are found in a media item, whether it is analogue or digital. (e.g. 1 video track, 2 audio tracks, 1 text track, 1 sprite track, etc.) Other configuration information specific to these identified tracks should be described using instantiationChannelConfiguration.

label.name: Instantiation Channel Configuration
label.description: The element instantiationChannelConfiguration is designed to indicate, at a general narrative level, the arrangement or configuration of specific channels or layers of information within an instantiation’s tracks. Examples are 2-track mono, 8- track stereo, or video track with alpha channel.

label.name: Instantiation Language
label.description: instantiationLanguage identifies the primary language of the tracks’ audio or text. Languages must be indicated using 3-letter codes standardized in ISO 639-2 or 639-3. If an instantiation includes more than one language, the element can be repeated. Alternately, both languages can be expressed in one element by separating two three-letter codes with a semicolon, i.e. eng;fre.

label.name: Essence Track
label.description: instantiationEssenceTrack is an XML container element that allows for grouping of related essenceTrack elements and their repeated use. Use instantiationEssenceTrack element to describe the individual streams that comprise an instantiation, such as audio, video, timecode, etc.

label.name: Track Type
label.description: essenceTrackType refers to the media type of the decoded data. Tracks may possibly be of these types: video, audio, caption, metadata, image, etc.

label.name: Track Type
label.description: essenceTrackType refers to the media type of the decoded data. Tracks may possibly be of these types: video, audio, caption, metadata, image, etc.

label.name: Track Identifier
label.description: essenceTrackIdentifier is an identifier of the track. Several audiovisual containers include such identifier schema to identify each track, such as MPEG2 PIDs or QuickTime Track ids

label.name: Track Identifier
label.description: essenceTrackIdentifier is an identifier of the track. Several audiovisual containers include such identifier schema to identify each track, such as MPEG2 PIDs or QuickTime Track ids

label.name: Track Identifier Source
label.description: the name of the software or tool that provided the Track Identifier

label.name: Track Identifier Source
label.description: the name of the software or tool that provided the Track Identifier

label.name: Track Standard
label.description: essenceTrackStandard should be be used with file-based instantiations to describe the broadcast standard of the video signal (e.g. NTSC, PAL) or to further clarify the standard of the essenceTrackEncoding format.

label.name: Track Standard
label.description: essenceTrackStandard should be be used with file-based instantiations to describe the broadcast standard of the video signal (e.g. NTSC, PAL) or to further clarify the standard of the essenceTrackEncoding format.

label.name: Track Encoding
label.description: essenceTrackEncoding identifies how the actual information in an instantiation is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme. Identifying the encoding used is beneficial for a number of reasons, including as a way to achieve reversible compression; for the construction of document indices to facilitate searching and access; or for efficient distribution of the information across data networks with differing bandwidths or pipeline capacities. Human-readable encoding value should be placed here.

label.name: Track Encoding
label.description: essenceTrackEncoding identifies how the actual information in an instantiation is compressed, interpreted, or formulated using a particular scheme. Identifying the encoding used is beneficial for a number of reasons, including as a way to achieve reversible compression; for the construction of document indices to facilitate searching and access; or for efficient distribution of the information across data networks with differing bandwidths or pipeline capacities. Human-readable encoding value should be placed here.

label.name: Track Data Rate
label.description: essenceTrackDataRate measures the amount of data used per time interval for encoded data. The data rate can be calculated by dividing the total data size of the track's encoded data by a time unit.

label.name: Track Data Rate
label.description: essenceTrackDataRate measures the amount of data used per time interval for encoded data. The data rate can be calculated by dividing the total data size of the track's encoded data by a time unit.

label.name: Track Time Start
label.description: essenceTrackTimeStart provides a time stamp for the beginning point of playback for a time-based essence track. It is likely that the content on a tape may begin an arbitrary amount of time after the beginning of the instantiation.

label.name: Track Time Start
label.description: essenceTrackTimeStart provides a time stamp for the beginning point of playback for a time-based essence track. It is likely that the content on a tape may begin an arbitrary amount of time after the beginning of the instantiation.

label.name: Track Duration
label.description: essenceTrackDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a track. It represents the track playback time

label.name: Track Duration
label.description: essenceTrackDuration provides a timestamp for the overall length or duration of a track. It represents the track playback time

label.name: Track Bit Depth
label.description: essenceTrackBitDepth specifies how much data is sampled when information is digitized, encoded, or converted for an instantiation (specifically, audio, video, or image). Bit depth is measured in bits and generally implies an arbitrary perception of quality during playback of an instantiation (the higher the bit depth, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Bit Depth
label.description: essenceTrackBitDepth specifies how much data is sampled when information is digitized, encoded, or converted for an instantiation (specifically, audio, video, or image). Bit depth is measured in bits and generally implies an arbitrary perception of quality during playback of an instantiation (the higher the bit depth, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Sampling Rate
label.description: essenceTrackSamplingRate measures how often data is sampled when information from the audio portion from an instantiation is digitized. For a digital audio signal, the sampling rate is measured in kilohertz and is an indicator of the perceived playback quality of the media item (the higher the sampling rate, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Sampling Rate
label.description: essenceTrackSamplingRate measures how often data is sampled when information from the audio portion from an instantiation is digitized. For a digital audio signal, the sampling rate is measured in kilohertz and is an indicator of the perceived playback quality of the media item (the higher the sampling rate, the greater the fidelity).

label.name: Track Playback Speed
label.description: essenceTrackPlaybackSpeed specifies the rate of units against time at which the media track should be rendered for human consumption. e.g., 15ips (inches per second).

label.name: Track Playback Speed
label.description: essenceTrackPlaybackSpeed specifies the rate of units against time at which the media track should be rendered for human consumption. e.g., 15ips (inches per second).

label.name: Track Frame Size
label.description: essenceTrackFrameSize measures the width and height of the encoded video or image track. The frame size refers to the size of the encoded pixels and not the size of the displayed image. It may be expressed as combination of pixels measured horizontally vs. the number of pixels of image/resolution data stacked vertically (interlaced and progressive scan).

label.name: Track Frame Size
label.description: essenceTrackFrameSize measures the width and height of the encoded video or image track. The frame size refers to the size of the encoded pixels and not the size of the displayed image. It may be expressed as combination of pixels measured horizontally vs. the number of pixels of image/resolution data stacked vertically (interlaced and progressive scan).

label.name: Track Aspect Ratio
label.description: essenceTrackAspectRatio indicates the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static image or moving image.

label.name: Track Aspect Ratio
label.description: essenceTrackAspectRatio indicates the ratio of horizontal to vertical proportions in the display of a static image or moving image.

label.name: Track Frame Rate
label.description: essenceTrackFrameRate is relevant to tracks of video track type only. The frame rate is calculated by dividing the total number of frames by the duration of the video track. By default measure frame rate in frames per second expressed as fps as a unit of measure. e.g., 24 fps.

label.name: Track Frame Rate
label.description: essenceTrackFrameRate is relevant to tracks of video track type only. The frame rate is calculated by dividing the total number of frames by the duration of the video track. By default measure frame rate in frames per second expressed as fps as a unit of measure. e.g., 24 fps.

label.name: Track Language
label.description: essenceTrackLanguage identifies the primary language of the tracks’ audio or text. Languages must be indicated using 3-letter codes standardized in ISO 639-2 or 639-3. If an instantiation includes more than one language, the element can be repeated. Alternately, both languages can be expressed in one element by separating two three-letter codes with a semicolon, i.e. eng;fre.

label.name: Track Language
label.description: essenceTrackLanguage identifies the primary language of the tracks’ audio or text. Languages must be indicated using 3-letter codes standardized in ISO 639-2 or 639-3. If an instantiation includes more than one language, the element can be repeated. Alternately, both languages can be expressed in one element by separating two three-letter codes with a semicolon, i.e. eng;fre.

label.name: Track Annotation
label.description: essenceTrackAnnotation can store any supplementary information about a track or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Track Annotation
label.description: essenceTrackAnnotation can store any supplementary information about a track or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Instantiation Annotation
label.description: instantiationAnnotation is used to add any supplementary information about an instantiation of the instantiation or the metadata used to describe it. It clarifies element values, terms, descriptors, and vocabularies that may not be otherwise sufficiently understood.

label.name: Instantiation Standard
label.description: If the instantiation is a physical item, instantiationStandard can be used to refer to the broadcast standard of the video signal (e.g. NTSC, PAL), or the audio encoding (e.g. Dolby A, vertical cut). If the instantiation is a digital item, instantiationStandard should be used to express the container format of the digital file (e.g. MXF).

label.name: Instantiation Alternative Modes
label.description: instantiationAlternativeModes is a catch-all metadata element that identifies equivalent alternatives to the primary visual, sound or textual information that exists in an instantiation. These are modes that offer alternative ways to see, hear, and read the content of an instantiation. Examples include DVI (Descriptive Video Information), SAP (Supplementary Audio Program), ClosedCaptions, OpenCaptions, Subtitles, Language Dubs, and Transcripts. For each instance of available alternativeModes, the mode and its associated language should be identified together, if applicable. Examples include ‘SAP in English,’ ‘SAP in Spanish,’ ‘Subtitle in French,’ ‘OpenCaption in Arabic.’

label.name: Instantiation Dimensions
label.description: instantiationDimensions is an element that specifies either the dimensions of a physical instantiation, or the high-level visual dimensions of a digital instantiation. For physical dimensions, usage examples might be 7″ for an audio reel. When describing visual dimensions, use this for high-level descriptors such as 1080p. Use the element frameSize to describe the pixel dimensions of a visual resource.

label.name: Checksum
label.description: Checksum, from a service such as MD5sum, BagIt, or CollectiveAccess' checksum utility. Repeat if multiple checksums exist, the object or object representation described outside of CollectiveAccess (for example, if a digital artwork is large enough to be stored across multiple hard drives).

label.name: Archival Information Package (AIP) Location
label.description: Related preservation AIP package location, preservation file and metadata from a service such as Archivematica or Preservica. Repeat if copies exist in different locations or storage media.

label.name: Copyright Statement
label.description: Use to state copyright statements over the resource.

label.name: Title Note
label.description: Record any notes about the title. Use for information about the source of the title (RAD 1.8B2), parallel titles and other title information (RAD 1.8B3), or any other title notes.

label.name: Title Note: Variations In Title
label.description: Variant title(s) or title(s) by which the unit has been previously known e.g. Previously known as Fonds Raoul Dandurand. Example: Previously known as Fonds Raoul Dandurand

label.name: Title Note: Source Of Title Proper
label.description: Example: Title based on contents of image

label.name: Title Note: Parallel Titles and Other Title Information
label.description: Notes on parallel titles and other title information not recorded in the Title and statement of responsibility area.

label.name: Repository
label.description: Western Front Gallery. If the originals are located elsewhere, enter location in Original location field.

label.name: Place Of Publication, Distribution, Etc.
label.description: A place of publication, distribution, etc., in the form and the grammatical case in which it appears e.g. Köln.

label.name: Place, Name, and Date of Manufacture
label.description: Use for an object/artifact only: place and name of the manufacturer if that information is found on the item.

label.name: Extent and Medium
label.description: Record the extent of the unit of description by giving the number of physical or logical units in arabic numerals and the unit of measurement. Give the specific medium (media) of the unit of description. (ISAD(G) 3.1.5. See also RAD 1.5B-D and 4.5C3-3).

label.name: Publisher, Distributor, Producer, Etc.
label.description: Record the place of publication, distribution or production followed by the name of the publisher, distributor, etc. If necessary, add one of the following terms to the name: distributor, production company, producer, or publisher. E.g. Montréal : National Film Board of Canada [production company]. (RAD 1.4C, D, E and F)”

label.name: Administrative/Biographical History
label.description: Record concisely any significant information on the origin, progress, development and work of the organization (or organizations) or on the life and work of the individual (or individuals) responsible for the creation of the unit of description. If additional information is available in a published source, cite the source. For persons or families record information such as full names and titles, dates of birth and death, place of birth, successive places of domicile, activities, occupation or offices, original and any other names, significant accomplishments, and place of death. For corporate bodies record information such as the official name, the dates of existence, enabling legislation, functions, purpose and development of the body, its administrative hierarchy, and earlier, variant or successive names. (ISAD(G) 3.2.2. See also RAD 1.7B)

label.name: Scope and Content
label.description: The sphere or kinds of activities that generated the records; the period of time and geographical area to which they pertain; their internal structure, including documentary forms; and the matters to which the records pertain.

label.name: Archival History
label.description: Record the successive transfers of ownership, responsibility and /or custody of the unit of description and indicate those actions, such as history of the arrangement, production of contemporary finding aids, re-use of the records for other purposes or software migrations, that have contributed to its present structure and arrangement. Give the dates of these actions, insofar as they can be ascertained. If the archival history is unknown, record that information. (ISAD(G) 3.2.3. See also RAD 1.7C)

label.name: Immediate Source of Acquisition or Transfer
label.description: Record the source from which the unit of description was acquired and the date and /or method of acquisition if any or all of this information is not confidential. If the source is unknown, record that information. (ISAD(G) 3.2.4. See also RAD 1.8B12)

label.name: Note: Physical Description
label.description: Notes on physical description that were not included in that field e.g. Includes: 40 cm of textual records, ca. 670 photographs, ca. 260 postcards, 4 watercolours. Example: Includes: 40 cm of textual records, ca. 670 photographs, ca. 260 postcards, 4 watercolours

label.name: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
label.description: Indicate any important physical conditions, such as preservation requirements, that affect the use of the unit of description. Note any software and /or hardware required to access the unit of description. (ISAD(G) 3.4.4. See also RAD 1.8B91)

label.name: Note: Accompanying Material
label.description: Details of accompanying material not mentioned in the Physical description area.

label.name: System Of Arrangement
label.description: Specify the internal structure, order and /or the system of classification of the unit of description. Note how these have been treated by the archivist. For electronic records, record or reference information on system design. (ISAD(G) 3.3.4. See also RAD 1.8B13)

label.name: Language
label.description: Record the language(s) and /or script(s) of the materials comprising the unit of description. Note any distinctive alphabets, scripts, symbol systems or abbreviations employed. (ISAD(G) 3.4.3. See also RAD 1.8B14)

label.name: Existence and Location of Originals
label.description: If the original of the unit of description is available (either in the institution or elsewhere) record its location, together with any significant control numbers. If the originals no longer exist, or their location is unknown, give that information. (ISAD(G) 3.5.1. See also RAD 1.8B15)

label.name: Existence and Location Of Copies
label.description: If the copy of the unit of description is available (either in the institution or elsewhere) record its location, together with any significant control numbers. (ISAD(G) 3.5.2. See also RAD 1.8B18)

label.name: Finding Aids
label.description: Give information about any finding aids that the repository or records creator may have that provide information relating to the context and contents of the unit of description. If appropriate, upload a copy. (ISAD(G) 3.4.5. See also RAD 1.8B17)

label.name: Related Materials
label.description: Associated material (1.8B18), Related groups of records in different fonds (1.8B20), Related groups of records within the same fonds (1.8B20a)

label.name: Accruals
label.description: Indicate if accruals are expected. Where appropriate, give an estimate of their quantity and frequency. (ISAD(G) 3.3.3. See also RAD 1.8B19)

label.name: Notes
label.description: Record specialized or other important information not accommodated by any of the defined elements of description. (ISAD(G) 3.6.1. See also RAD 1.8B)

label.name: Publication Note
label.description: Record a citation to, and /or information about a publication that is about or based on the use, study, or analysis of the unit of description. Include references to published facsimiles or transcriptions. (ISAD(G) 3.5.4)

label.name: Name Of Publisher, Distributor, etc.
label.description: The name of the publisher, distributor, etc., following the place(s) to which it relates e.g. Vancouver : UBC Press. If place is unknown, use s.l.; if publisher is unknown, use s.n. Example: New York : RCA Victor

label.name: Statement Of Responsibility
label.description: Transcribe only explicit statements of responsibility as they appear on the item. Example: Iron maiden [GMD]: aces high / by Derek Riggs. (RAD 1.1F)

label.name: Title Note: Attribution and Conjectures
label.description: Notes on authors to whom the unit being described has been attributed; cite sources, if appropriate.

label.name: Date Note
label.description: Use to record any notes on the date(s) of creation, publication, distribution, accumulation or collection. (RAD 1.8B8 and 1.8B8a)

label.name: Scope and Content
label.description: Give a summary of the scope (such as, time periods, geography) and content, (such as documentary forms, subject matter, administrative processes) of the unit of description, appropriate to the level of description. (ISAD(G) 3.3.1. See also RAD 1.7D)

label.name: Archivist's Note
label.description: Record notes on sources consulted in preparing the description and who prepared it. (ISAD(G) 3.7.1)

label.name: Rules or Conventions
label.description: Record the international, national and /or local rules or conventions followed in preparing the description. (ISAD(G) 3.7.2)

label.name: Note: Caption, Signatures and Inscriptions
label.description: Transcribe a caption, heading, or motto if different from the title recorded in the title and statement of responsibility area. Also record any signatures or inscriptions and where they appear. Example: Inscribed in pencil on upper right corner of front endpaper: R.S. Cassels, Xmas 1894, Toronto. (RAD 4.8B5 and 4.8B7)

label.name: Note: Signatures and inscriptions
label.description: Example: Inscribed in pencil on upper right corner of front endpaper: R.S. Cassels, Xmas 1894, Toronto. Inscribed in pencil on upper right corner of front endpaper: R.S. Cassels, Xmas 1894, Toronto or Signed by the author.

label.name: Statement Of Scale (Cartographic)
label.description: Example.: Scale 1:10 000.

label.name: Statement Of Projection (Cartographic)
label.description: Example: Universal Transverse Mercator Proj.

label.name: Statement Of Coordinates (Cartographic)
label.description: Example: 51° 28' 38" N etc.

label.name: Statement Of Scale (Architectural)
label.description: Example: Scale 1/4" = 10 ft.

label.name: Issuing Jurisdiction and Denomination (Philatelic)
label.description: Example: Canada.

label.name: Denomination (Philatelic)
label.description: Example: Newfoundland : 5 pence.

label.name: Edition Statement
label.description: Look for terms like edition, issue or version (or their equivalents in other languages) e.g. 2nd ed.

label.name: Reference To Published Descriptions.
label.description: Provide a citation for publications in which the archival item has appeared.

label.name: Date(s) Of Description(s)
label.description: Record the date(s) the entry was prepared and /or revised. (ISAD(G) 3.7.3)

label.name: Finding Aid
label.description: Narrative biography for entity and source.

settings.setting: Related by extent field, e.g. 1 of 2, 2 of 3 and so on.
Related by extent field, e.g. 1 of 2, 2 of 3 and so on.
Related by extent field, e.g. 1 of 2, 2 of 3 and so on.
Provide either a formal title or a supplied title appropriate to the unit of description. Example: Kate Craig fonds. (ISAD(G) 3.1.2. See also RAD 1.1B)
Record the date(s) of creation or accumulation of the unit of description as a single date or a range of dates. (ISAD(G) 3.1.3. See also RAD 1.4B)
